document.title: Georgia Standards of Excellence CTEA Business, Management and Administration

EDBBDEFECAC34F4EB98E7AF055246584.description: Explore the competitive events related to the content of this course and the required competencies, skills, and knowledge for each related event for individual, team, and chapter competitions.

87C5533D61CD4C868B24B099B3884F3B.description: Explain how participation in career and technology education student organizations can promote lifelong responsibility for community service and professional development.

577C48544F5E4679949DAF7695F20286.description: Explore the local, state, and national opportunities available to students through participation in related student organization (FBLA) including but not limited to conferences, competitions, community service, philanthropy, and other FBLA activities.

7A3A854BAFFD4A1E83AC85463732C1E9.description: Explore the impact and opportunities a student organization (FBLA) can develop to bring business and education together in a positive working relationship through innovative leadership and career development programs.

0DA4312B04304817A4E23FC207268415.description: Explain the goals, mission and objectives of Future Business Leaders of America.

C8FD6B576C114505BEBCEE6071DF0F8B.description: Explore how related student organizations are integral parts of career and technology education courses through leadership development, school and community service projects, entrepreneurship development, and competitive events.

37F28A052CFD4685BF0FA3D3AE775481.description: Complete a needs assessment for job types for a particular business.

6537B0E056614ED68A530035AFF4CEAF.description: Develop a plan for training and evaluating employees.

20F584614E5643959958379DEA6BE480.description: Demonstrate appropriate ways to fire/dismiss an employee.

58734A10F738464E8D24598F327AE7BB.description: Identify valid reasons for an employee to be fired.

7DD70197F68943CF9C7936201E0F6AE0.description: Develop a work schedule for employees.

E4580487E19F4E5FBE296BD282009781.description: Create a hiring plan for accepting applications, interviewing, and hiring employees.

AC259306475B4703B29BD57CEE0A0BFE.description: Define the culture and demographics of a specific business and outline the type of employee needed for successful business operation.

7AD70590B2664249BA51A3B376D5CFAD.description: Understand the concepts, systems, and strategies needed to acquire, motivate, develop, and terminate employees.

CE469817EEE84FFF873D0403F67CEE0D.description: Critique the effectiveness of a business plan for a specific business.

3C9A9D4E97D94AC49EFC2FFB9383D5D9.description: Develop an operations plan for a business.

2A2A7BC6560C493984B2349BC6A873CB.description: Develop a financial plan for a business, including start-up costs and pro forma financial statements (Profit & Loss and Income Statement).

41DE60DD78774E31814481017E46F064.description: Identify financial considerations and project the total cost needed to start a business (i.e. start-up costs, ongoing operational expenses, and cash reserves).

0688ACA68D9A42FA831C394D0BA11E00.description: Describe the business environment and competition.

FFE1B261800E47EBBA0D5A563832F34D.description: Describe the business venture in a company overview

57ED2E5EEA3B4FB099D9EFA26B2ACC70.description: Plan the product or service for a business by identifying the resources and costs needed to produce a specific product or service.

5525C3F87C5A4436A391A079362CD546.description: Research, develop, and present a business plan.

5F5003485D284EC0A944619903DA31B9.description: Simulate or operate small business daily operations.

032FCB0FC5144635B837606D3669C0E4.description: Develop and document expectations for operating a business including but not limited to financial records, purchasing records, inventory controls, and technology use.

D40FB481088645AEB54766C83DFB5875.description: Model the practice of operating a business based on plan of financial success.

8F4ABEDC1CD74558B7CA41DDC10D99E8.description: Explain importance of having documented policies and practices to operate a business

7BF21947763D45EA83366F74E0F91B86.description: Develop policies to ensure a productive work environment and strategies to motivate employees.

866E6150D18945E9A001F8D7728ADEF1.description: Explain product liability and the impact on the business.

D8D032109C6049B6BACACB42B11E4771.description: Research safe business practices and overview of OSHA regulations for a particular career area and state the importance and legal rationale for maintaining a safe business environment.

C5B600A0BE80470DA672BF9E1B99928A.description: Manage the image of the business by critiquing the logo, slogan, online, and social presence of the business.

3EC640D8B1BE4CADB13EEAD580EC7A09.description: Create business goals, a vision, and a mission statement that will guide the operations of the business decisions.

17A2DAF9831A4E2D8A98BAAF0E951C94.description: Use technology to implement computer skills and applications to maximize business operations.

5D136C2559FA4E3FA8DADEA4318078AE.description: Manage and operate a business (or simulate the management and operation) through daily tasks and activities of a small business.

D45083156705429C869674BA1EB41F3B.description: Explain how the state of economy can affect the success of a business.

29005AC348074A1287AE41205EF8242B.description: Identify insurance needed by businesses (worker's compensation, liability, life/key person, health, and automobile).

FE932FA8F6F34B39B03ECF99BE021709.description: Identify taxes imposed on businesses (sales tax, unemployment tax, income tax, payroll tax, self-employment tax) and the impact on the business of expenses.

28C165F28F154D2DA4AB647733E0E814.description: Determine the best practice for keeping business records, technology influence of record keeping.

C38881C35FFF4EAE9D1F15A47BC9EA1B.description: Compare and contrast common sources for funding a business

CC17C1D301544FF6B5396FC799590CA9.description: Research inventory tracking methods to ensure accurate inventory to maximize business profit.

DC65E4087722490794ADAE923CA22239.description: Evaluate the financial condition of a firm based on business records.

89CA01976B67448596765EB119FD76F6.description: Analyze financial statements (Income Statement and Balance Sheet) and interpret the meaning of the statement for the business.

7BE734BC5CB04BA9B317794699042288.description: Define seed money, profit, fixed assets, variable assets, short and long term assets, short and long term liabilities, depreciation, cost vs. revenue and pro forma.

B124C71496DF4E8DB9122D0FF6837A7F.description: Analyze financial issues relating to successful business ownership.

E33FC45E2C5A469D9FF00B957B96EC7B.description: Formulate a plan to maintain customer loyalty, response to customer concerns and ideas, and ability to track customers.

BF4246E56D194C618D557F7B69B91CC3.description: Create a plan to increase market share considering the impact of competition, customer feedback, networking, selling on credit, etc.

F1F0F2E44EF543DF85E08BB4DF2DB3E8.description: Detail the importance of technology to business operations and performance.

624F3CBBC6664C21B096E82515485CF0.description: Create an advertising campaign to promote a business product or service.

5AFBB584CA8B458286D6AAC5B40E74C4.description: Explain how to build community relations and provide examples of types of activities a business can explore to increase community involvement.

F1899D81D16F4D3DAB50B3E01ECCD920.description: Compare advantages and disadvantages of different types of advertising mediums (social media, print, television, radio, free publicity, etc.).

4A87F5D4B5A14DD5B87E5FBA699AD980.description: Establish a customer profile for specific business venture.

83218828F1A342AF9258F43B7E83C3D4.description: Conduct market research to determine target market using primary and secondary data sources to locate information.

4629BE0FD14343C59DD65DC35D422AC4.description: Use market segmentation (behavioral, demographic, psychographic, and geographic differences) to define the target market.

2F26D9662917418A9225167EFBCCF980.description: Develop a marketing plan to identify, reach, and retain customers in a specific target market.

B8169DEA4DFF484B9BD4D534BFC34EDD.description: Compare and contrast business to business transactions and business to consumer transactions

17F320A3C8064FD7B7C0454F5C306AF2.description: Research and determine the impact of small businesses/entrepreneurship has on market economies—locally, regionally, and globally.

76E3C6192FFE49B9A42ECCA18D915D2C.description: Predict the risk on future investing of the company based on new technology, health, education, and training of workforce.

5076C30773514C5F8D2A8FD048FF87A7.description: Compare and contrast current economic stability to determine what to produce, how to produce, and for whom to produce.

DC64CED166FF4DF386744065B5B46F7E.description: Explain how specialization and voluntary exchange between buyers and sellers increase the satisfaction of both parties

0E9F496B84C34D0E9617BE895C34CD1D.description: Defend why limited productive resources and unlimited wants result in scarcity, opportunity costs, and tradeoffs for individuals, businesses, and governments.

24FA23BCD2174CF6B80FB6BFBA759036.description: Explain economic concepts of scarcity, price, opportunity costs, supply and demand, forms of economic utility created by business activities, distinguishing between economic goods and services, and explain the factors of production.

4C0C53F9204248F4A0AFE4BEF1243515.description: Understand and apply the basic economic principles and concepts fundamental to entrepreneurship.

45C08532F3FE4BBEAADDF74D35F7766A.description: Describe how households, businesses, and governments are interdependent and interact through flows of goods, services, and money and the impact on a local business from this interaction.

A68FCB04DFE2424CB00F4A3988F660AD.description: Compare the cost/feasibility of purchasing, leasing, or building.

CB3FE10DBE084C08B53EB18F959EA230.description: Identify licenses, inspections, zoning laws, covenants, codes, and government regulations needed for type and location of business.

32D69AFF736F4201B6ED9B9D938B04B9.description: Describe the roles of government in a market economy and explain why government provides public goods and services, redistributes income, protects property rights, and resolves market failures.

95DD93510FF744E298142780B9C32C54.description: Analyze the four types of market structures in the United States economy: monopoly, oligopoly, monopolistic competition, and pure competition.

EDD45D723A43418994916F43815DB4F9.description: Compare and contrast legal forms of business ownership (sole proprietorship, partnership, corporation, S-corporation, LLC).

0E08FB5D62144F1087271EE61E9EFCE3.description: Explain and detail legal form of business ownership and the impact of government's role on business.

E2781D5304F94EB19F036A73594BC4F0.description: Explore management styles and apply styles to personal traits of entrepreneur.

07A14E52281043928EC536488E67F7F0.description: Compare and contrast business activities with the impact on financial, human resources, risk, and strategic management.

C988D8574C88480999B7F32CF9790DE6.description: Assess opportunities for venture creation, global trends and opportunities, and feasibility of ideas for business venture.

DD28C22A66E14A71B9FCBF7DF5D721B2.description: Model how business decisions are made while operating a successful business.

63D04A6444DD4C0289FA0FDE1A63CA35.description: Give examples of how rational decision-making entails comparing the marginal benefits and the marginal costs of an action.

7C8CB193F1374C77A716F79BC6E4B7E7.description: Explain how markets, prices, and competition influence economic behavior.

78B20F744BF647E38C69279C61C29E30.description: Explain how the Law of Demand, the Law of Supply, prices, and profits work to determine production and distribution in a market economy.

9E3F4A1FD1554281884F5EDD93784EE9.description: Apply fundamental business concepts that affect business decision making.

623DFFFDB3C848229EC88C1B20B7AC97.description: Explore team dynamics, managing conflict, and handling difficult situations with customers, business contacts, and staff.

AF77B880EAC24C03A0D09F1A6946DC70.description: Present benefits to satisfy and exceed customer needs and model closing a deal.

2C084A27747A48DDAEEE8CB8E2DB84EA.description: Demonstrate appropriate and effective questioning techniques (open-ended) to identify needs of prospective clients

AAB2F66AE7C84681AB073B858B346009.description: Exhibit effective introduction of self and business to target market

E93B566A45914788AED22FE20EE68917.description: Develop strategies for following up on business leads and business opportunities through multiple outlets (social media, existing prospect bases, cold calling, referrals, telemarketing, etc.).

D7ECE4E09EF54BEC84C5F5E3B991A0F4.description: Explore the impact of and how to network with other business contacts through work and social environments.

02F8D9856DC1484D81A94360124FA79B.description: Demonstrate effective listening and speaking skills using proper grammar and appropriate vocabulary for target audience.

F28DB45635824D52BF2C508A513E4D37.description: Define and model importance of effective communication—oral, written, and nonverbal—with staff and customers.

81D5379DB52345FDBCF3F5E5F5150D40.description: Use and model concepts, strategies, and systems needed to interact and present effectively to others.

203D54BC336E4D48ADC1B5105F2C7024.description: Connect entrepreneurial success with personal traits and behaviors through analyzing successful entrepreneurs by identifying leadership style.

8CB5627372BF402EB986B26168AE070D.description: Differentiate the unique traits, behaviors and processes that distinguish an entrepreneur from an employee or manager.

319C892520F842708F2765BDE9910F0A.description: Categorize the characteristics of a successful entrepreneur, including the skills and ethical responsibilities

4FE6900D119949668B309E6C79910A38.description: Explain the role of entrepreneur in their own business, the local community, and the economic development of the global market

EE7E38FF98BC450C8DCFB22B7EAC8530.description: Relate concepts and processes associated with entrepreneurial success and the personal traits and behaviors associated with successful entrepreneurial performance.

7A75EFEC6845445C82799764FAF490F1.description: Present a professional image through appearance, behavior and language.

E4581F7B660B47DEBDFA05AB96FA6D45.description: Apply the appropriate skill sets to be productive in a changing, technological, diverse workplace to be able to work independently and apply teamwork skills.

7B3239AEA4944908B766D886B58DB4CA.description: Model work readiness traits required for success in the workplace including integrity, honesty, accountability, punctuality, time management, and respect for diversity.

93BA5A4E34504DF2B230CA188ECADB63.description: Exhibit critical thinking and problem solving skills to locate, analyze and apply information in career planning and employment situations.

D396054EFDD8435FA44CC1B9A7CFF20F.description: Demonstrate creativity by asking challenging questions and applying innovative procedures and methods.

07F576F39BA648F1A8AB01E783529452.description: Communicate effectively through writing, speaking, listening, reading, and interpersonal abilities.

D0066BDC63E34325A49F16E01616A8D1.description: Demonstrate employability skills required by business and industry.
